oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Sylvia - Parts 4 and 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Sylvia (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 4 and 5. Recording is from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Sylvia
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Sylvia introduction voiceover] -- (00:32) Ralph Emery praises Sylvia and invites her to introduce "Sweet Yesterday" while discussing fulfilling careers -- (03:11) Emery introduces Vern Gosdin and "Way Down Deep" -- (03:40) Emery invites Sylvia to discuss her recent divorce and "Winter Heart" -- (07:00) Sylvia reveals she used to open for Charley Pride while introducing "Honky Tonk Blues" -- (07:53) Emery guesses "The Boy Gets Around" will be Sylvia's next single, and Sylvia calls it her favorite from the album -- (08:54) Emery asks Sylvia to introduce Conway Twitty; additionally, Sylvia and Emery share stories of people touring together but never talking to each other -- (10:32) Sylvia reflects on her father's wisdom and how he does not shake hands -- (13:10) Emery inquires about Sylvia's experience with bull fights while discussing "The Matador" -- (13:53) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Sylvia outro voiceover] -- (15:12) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Sylvia introduction voiceover] -- (15:50) Emery inquires about how large Sylvia's family is, and her family's opinion on her career -- (17:02) Emery inquires about the financial struggles Sylvia had when she first arrived in Nashville -- (20:29) Emery changes the subject to have Sylvia introduce "Tonight I'm Getting Friendly With the Blues" -- (22:41) Emery informs Sylvia "I Never Quite Got Back From Loving You" will be the last song played off of Sylvia's album -- (23:57) Emery tries to equate Sylvia to a sum of other musicians and inquires about her acting career -- (26:24) Emery praises Eddie Rabbitt and Sylvia describes her curiosity for "Plain as the Paint on My Face" -- (26:58) Emery praises Sylvia's awards, and both discuss how Sylvia gets her nails done often -- (28:14) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Sylvia outro voiceover]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Sylvia, 1956-;
